articles.author: Gram Slattery, Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: The ceasefire brokered by U.S. President Donald Trump between Iran and Israel appeared to be holding on Wednesday a day after both countries signalled that their air war had ended, at least for now.
articles.title: Fragile ceasefire holding, Trump envoy says peace talks with Iran 'promising'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China and Taiwan clashed over their competing interpretations of history in an escalating war of words over what Beijing views as provocations from Taiwan's government, and said it is impossible to "invade" what is already Chinese land.
articles.title: China, Taiwan clash over history, Beijing says can't 'invade' what is already Chinese territory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam will remove the death penalty for eight offences from next month, including embezzlement and activities aimed at overthrowing the government, state media reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Vietnam to remove death penalty for embezzlement, anti-state crimes

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sabine Siebold, Jeff Mason
articles.description: NATO leaders gather in The Hague on Wednesday for a summit tailor-made for U.S. President Donald Trump, with European allies hoping a pledge to hike defence spending will prompt him to dispel doubts about his commitment to the alliance.
articles.title: NATO leaders set to back Trump defence spending goal at Hague summit

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: The United States is giving $30 million to a controversial humanitarian group delivering aid in war-torn Gaza despite concern among some U.S. officials about the month-old operation and the killing of Palestinians near food distribution sites, according to four sources and a document seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: US to give $30 million to Gaza aid operation despite violence concerns

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 29 Palestinians in Gaza and ordered new evacuations on Tuesday, local medics and residents said, in further bloodshed shortly after Israel and Iran reached a ceasefire to end a 12-day air war.
articles.title: Israel kills 29 in further Gaza bloodshed after reaching truce with Iran

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: The trial of an Australian woman accused of murdering three of her estranged husband's elderly relatives using toxic mushrooms entered its final stages on Wednesday, with the jury soon to begin its deliberations in a case that has gripped the nation.
articles.title: Erin Patterson trial: Australia awaits verdict in mushroom murder case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said seven personnel, an officer and six soldiers, were killed in fighting in the southern Gaza Strip on Tuesday.
articles.title: Seven Israeli soldiers killed during combat in Gaza, military says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran executed three men on Wednesday, after they were convicted of collaborating with Israel's Mossad spy agency and smuggling equipment used in an assassination, the judiciary's Mizan news agency reported.
articles.title: Iran hangs three men for spying for Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile attack on Ukraine's southeastern Dnipropetrovsk region on Tuesday killed at least nine people, damaged civilian infrastructure and wounded dozens of train passengers, officials said.
articles.title: Russian missile attack kills nine, damages passenger train in southeast Ukraine
